page.title: 08 Farming Dairy
page.content:
Dairy farmers keep cows for milk. The sheds need to kept very clean. The farmer has to make sure that everything he uses is clean. Cows need two gallons of water a day. They like to eat grass, cowcake, hay and silage. They need to eat it because it produces milk.
In the morning the farmer gets up and brings the cows from the field. He puts the cows in the dairy, then he puts the teat suckers on the teats.
Thery're milked and the milk goes in a big tank. The milk lorry then comes and takes the milk.
It goes to the depot and is pastuerised and put into bottles or made into cream, butter, and cheese.
